ygData.subject: RE: RE: [EQ-Necromancers] Expansion Spells
ygData.msgSnippet: I said in my last post eq.castersrealm.com is taken from the test server last night. please goto this site and check it out. As what john said This all may not
ygData.messageBody:
I said in my last post eq.castersrealm.com is taken from the test server
last night. please goto this site and check it out. As what john said This
all may not hold true.
-----Original Message-----
From: John Sanders [mailto:john.sanders@...]
Sent: Thursday, March 02, 2000 10:58 AM
To: EQ_Necromancer@onelist.com
Subject: Re: [EQ_Necromancer] RE: [EQ-Necromancers] Expansion Spells


From: "John Sanders" <john.sanders@...>

There are new spells... I've seen the links for the
Druid/Cleric/Ranger/Pally spells, unfortunately, I don't remember where.

Apparently, there will be new spells given at each lvl. Please note that
the information I saw was taken from a prerelease script and what I say
may
not hold true by time of the Kunark release.

Zarbon
PS.. If the changes hold true... there are going to be a lot of ticked
off
druids.

----- Original Message -----
From: Trizzen Do'Trevan <trizzen@...>
To: <EQ_Necromancer@onelist.com>
Sent: Thursday, March 02, 2000 10:47 AM
Subject: Re: [EQ_Necromancer] RE: [EQ-Necromancers] Expansion Spells


> From: Trizzen Do'Trevan <trizzen@...>
>
> Anybody know if they even have decided to put in new
> spells? Last I heard they did not confirm that there
> were going to be new ones....
>
> --- Jason Brown <jasonb@...> wrote:
> >
> > The Vampirism spell would be really cool -- I'd like
> > to see some new pets
> > though. I'm talking about differing types, like
> > demons, ghouls, zombies, undead
> > dracoliches. You know -- the usual. Make them
> > research and high level -- they
> > have the same affect as the other pets, just look
> > different. I'd run from a
> > Necro with a 10' tall spikey-horned leather-winged
> > demon walking behind him that
> > said
> > "<name> is my master."
> >
> > Just an idea :P
> >
> > Jason Brown
> > TeleVox Software, Inc.
